label: AB_hP12_194_af_bf-001
title: CMo Structure
comments:
Note that all of the atoms sit on close packed $<$$0001$$>$ planes. The stacking sequence may be written: \begin{center} \begin{tabular}{|c|c|c|c|c|c|c|c|c|c|c|c|c|} \hline Atom & Mo-II & C-II & C-I & C-II & Mo-II & Mo-I & Mo-II & C-II & C-I & C-II & Mo-II & Mo-I \\ \hline Position & B & C & A & B & C & A & C & B & A & C & B & A \\ \hline \end{tabular} \end{center} ~ \vspace{-.25in} 
 Thus the Mo-II atoms and all of the C atoms are always in an fcc-like local environment, while the Mo-I atoms are in an hcp-like local environment. Like \href{current_web_home_dir/AB3C4_hP16_194_c_af_ef-001}{AlN$_{3}$Ti$_{4}$}, this is a MAX phase. For more information, see (Radovic, 2013).
